AI
==

News coverage on artificial intelligence and machine learning tech, the companies building them, and the ethical issues AI raises today. This encompasses [generative AI](https://techcrunch.com/tag/generative-ai/), including large language models, text-to-image and text-to-video models; speech recognition and generation; and predictive analytics.

AMD unveils AI server as OpenAI taps its newest chips
=====================================================

By [Reuters](/team/reuters/)

Published:¬†June 12, 2025 at 4:02PM EDT

Semi-conductor chips are assembled and organized on a workbench before a ribbon-cutting ceremony to mark the opening of a Nanotronics manufacturing centre at the Brooklyn Navy Yard, Wednesday, April 28, 2021, in the Brooklyn borough of New York. (AP Photo/John Minchillo)

SAN JOSE ‚Äî Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su on Thursday unveiled a new artificial intelligence server for 2026 that aims to challenge Nvidia‚Äôs flagship offerings as OpenAI‚Äôs CEO said the ChatGPT creator would adopt AMD‚Äôs latest chips.

AMD shares were down about 2% after the company announced the news at a developer conference in San Jose, California, called ‚ÄúAdvancing AI.‚Äù

Su took the stage to discuss the MI350 series and MI400 series AI chips that she said would compete with Nvidia‚Äôs Blackwell line of processors

The MI400 series of chips will be the basis of a new server called ‚ÄúHelios‚Äù that AMD plans to release next year.

The move comes as the competition between Nvidia and other AI chip firms has shifted away from selling individual chips to selling servers packed with scores or even hundreds of processors, woven together with networking chips from the same company.

*   [**Latest updates on investing here**](https://www.bnnbloomberg.ca/investing/)

During its keynote presentation, AMD said that many aspects of the Helios servers - such as the networking standards - would be made openly available and shared with competitors such as Intel.

The move was a direct swipe at market leader Nvidia, which uses proprietary technology called NVLink to string together its chips but has recently started to license that technology as pressure mounts from rivals.

‚ÄúThe future of AI is not going to be built by any one company or in a closed ecosystem. It‚Äôs going to be shaped by open collaboration across the industry,‚Äù Su said.

Su was joined onstage by OpenAI‚Äôs Sam Al

output.title: AI News - Engadget
output.text:
Find in-depth AI news from Engadget's experienced editorial team. We cover all the latest artificial intelligence advancements including AI chatbots, LLMs, AI image generation, AI voice.... 

[](/)[Sign in](https://oidc.engadget.com/login?dest=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com&pspid=1197802876&activity=header)

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

AI News
=======

The latest news and reviews on artificial intelligence software, hardware and AI research.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Latest

*   #### [How to turn off Google‚Äôs AI Overviews in web searches](https://www.engadget.com/big-tech/how-to-turn-off-googles-ai-overviews-in-web-searches-170009873.html)
    
    If you find Google's AI Overview more irritating than helpful, here's now to turn it off in Chrome.
    
*   #### [Wikipedia cancels plan to test AI summaries after editors skewer the idea](https://www.engadget.com/ai/wikipedia-cancels-plan-to-test-ai-summaries-after-editors-skewer-the-idea-200029899.html)
    
    'Yuck,' one editor wrote.
    
*   #### [Apple's AI-infused Siri may not show up until spring 2026](https://www.engadget.com/ai/apples-ai-infused-siri-may-not-show-up-until-spring-2026-221212681.html)
    
    Apple might not release its Apple Intelligence update to Siri until Spring 2026, nearly two years after it first announced the more capable version of its voice assistant.
    
*   #### [Meta is helping to fund geothermal energy projects in New Mexico](https://www.engadget.com/big-tech/meta-is-helping-to-fund-geothermal-energy-projects-in-new-mexico-212222815.html)
    
    Meta is helping fund geothermal energy development in New Mexico to power more of its AI data centers.
    

*   #### [Google DeepMind is sharing its AI forecasts with the National Weather Service](https://www.engadget.com/ai/google-deepmind-is-sharing-its-ai-forecasts-with-the-national-weather-service-173506456.html)
    
    It also has a new website where you can see its predictions.
    
*   #### [Microsoft's Copilot Vision AI helper is now available on Windows in the US](https://www.engadget.com/ai/microsofts-copilot-vision-ai-helper-is-now-available-on-windows-in-the-us-160034369.html)
    
    Starting today, Windows 10 and 11 users in the US can try out Copilot's new Vision feature.
    
*   #### [Apple Intelligence announcements at WWDC: Everything Apple revealed for iOS, macOS and more](https://www.engadget.com/ai/apple-intelligence-announcements-at-wwdc-everything-apple-revealed-for-ios-macos-and-more-171133645.html)
    
    Updates to Apple Intelligence will power new live translations features and more across iOS 26 and macOS Tahoe.
    
*   #### [Meta is cracking down on AI 'nudify' apps](https://www.engadget.com/social-media/meta-is-cracking-down-on-ai-nudify-apps-100034964.html)
    
    Meta is finally cracking down on "nudify" apps that use AI to generate nonconsensual nude and explicit images of celebrities, influencers and others.
    

*   #### [SAG-AFTRA has suspended its gaming industry strike over AI protections](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/sag-aftra-has-suspended-its-gaming-industry-strike-over-ai-protections-204240996.html)
    
    SAG-AFTRA has suspended its almost year-long strike against ten game studios.
    
*   #### [Meta launches a surreal AI video editor](https://www.engadget.com/ai/meta-launches-a-surreal-ai-video-editor-173907584.html)
    
    Translucent puffer suit, anyone?
    
*   #### [Disney and Universal Studios file suit against Midjourney for copyright infringement](https://www.engadget.com/entertainment/disney-and-universal-studios-file-suit-against-midjourney-for-copyright-infringement-154206053.html)
    
    Disney and NBCUniversal have filed suit against Midjourney alleging rampant copyright infringement.
    
*   #### [OpenAI adds the o3-pro model to ChatGPT today](https://www.engadget.com/ai/openai-adds-the-o3-pro-model-to-chatgpt-today-212126136.html)
    
    The new models are still coming at a rapid-fire pace from OpenAI.
    

*   #### [OpenAI won WWDC 2025](https://www.engadget.com/ai/openai-won-wwdc-2025-191216116.html)
    
    If you weren‚Äôt paying close attention to Apple‚Äôs WWDC 2025 keynote, it was easy to miss how much time Apple spent talking about OpenAI.
    
*   #### [Qualcomm says its new AR1+ Gen 1 chip can handle AI directly on smart glasses](https://www.engadget.com/wearables/qualcomm-says-its-new-ar1-gen-1-chip-can-handle-ai-directly-on-smart-glasses-163002410.html)
    
    Qualcomm's has launched its latest processor for smart glasses, and though it's a modest upgrade over the previous chip, it has a new trick.
    
*   #### [To fix Apple Intelligence, Apple needs to be honest about its capabilities](https://www.engadget.com/ai/to-fix-apple-intelligence-apple-needs-to-be-honest-about-its-capabilities-130046256.html)
    
    At WWDC 2024, Apple failed its customers. This year, the company needs to do better.

result.content:
# Latest Developments in Artificial Intelligence (AI) - June 13, 2025

Today, the AI landscape continues to evolve with groundbreaking announcements and strategic moves by major tech players. AMD has unveiled its new AI server, "Helios," which is set to challenge Nvidia's dominance in the AI chip market. This development comes as OpenAI confirms its adoption of AMD's latest MI400 series chips, signaling a shift in the competitive dynamics of AI hardware„Äê2-2„Äë. Meanwhile, Meta has made headlines by acquiring a 49% stake in Scale AI for $14.8 billion, further solidifying its commitment to AI innovation„Äê2-5„Äë.

<!--more-->

In other news, Google is testing "Audio Overviews" for search queries, a feature designed to enhance accessibility and user experience„Äê2-0„Äë. Additionally, Microsoft has rolled out its Vision AI helper, "Copilot," for Windows users in the U.S., showcasing advancements in AI-driven productivity tools„Äê2-9„Äë. On the ethical front, Meta is cracking down on AI applications that generate non-consensual explicit images, addressing growing concerns about the misuse of generative AI„Äê2-9„Äë.

As the AI industry continues to expand, these developments highlight the ongoing race for innovation and the importance of addressing ethical challenges. Stay tuned for more updates as these stories unfold.
